main event: A resident of Portland, Maine reported seeing a fast-moving, unidentified spherical object in the sky on November 11, 1959.
interesting points: The object was white in color and moving at a very high rate of speed across the northern horizon.
The witness initially thought it might be a weather balloon or meteorite, but discounted these possibilities due to the object's erratic and swerving motion.
The witness reported the sighting to the Department of the Air Force for investigation.
The Air Force concluded that the case contained insufficient data to make a definite determination.
